title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DETROIT (AP) – In the cauldron of The Palace of Auburn Hills, Reggie Miller delivered a performance for the ages, a stunning 39-point masterpiece that single-handedly carved up the Detroit Pistons and carried the Indiana Pacers to a gritty 95-89 victory.

From the opening tip, this was Miller’s show. He was a phantom in motion, weaving through screens and leaving defenders grasping at air. The Pistons, known for their physical brand of defense, had no answer for the sharpshooter’s relentless assault. Jumper after jumper splashed through the net, each one a dagger chipping away at Detroit’s resolve. He was surgical, efficient, and utterly unstoppable, turning a crucial divisional battle into his personal showcase.

While Miller’s offensive fireworks lit up the scoreboard, the Pacers’ defense provided the necessary grit to seal the win. Detroit’s Grant Hill, a superstar in his own right, was harassed into a difficult night, his 22 points coming at a cost. The Pacers swarmed the paint, effectively neutralizing the Pistons’ interior game and forcing them into contested looks that simply could not keep pace with Miller’s incendiary rhythm.

In the game’s final, tense minutes, it was Miller who iced it. With the Pistons desperately clawing back, he calmly drained a series of clutch free throws, a fitting exclamation point on a historic night. The final horn sounded on a 95-89 win, but the real story was the singular brilliance of number 31. On this night, Reggie Miller wasn't just a scorer; he was a force of nature, and the Detroit Pistons were merely in his path.
